subject: Re: [junit] Testing a TestCase - Making sure a failure is reported
msgSnippet: I assume you mean a Class instance when you say, an invalid class . In that case, if you ve instantiated a Class successfully, then how can it be invalid?
messageBody:
I assume you mean a "Class" instance when you say, "an invalid class". In
that case, if you've instantiated a Class successfully, then how can it be
invalid? It certainly represents a valid class, but perhaps that class is
not in the proper hierarchy. My guess is your TestCase either tries to cast
(ClassCastException) or send the class object a message
(NoSuchMethodError). Either way you should get an error/failure reported.

Can you post some sample code to help us understand your problem more
fully?

Thanks.

Subject: [junit] Testing a TestCase - Making sure a failure is reported



Hi everyone,

I have this TestCase which I'm testing... Sounds strange, but this is part
of my refactoring work. The TestCase in question receives a class as
parameter, tests some common stuff on it, and returns.

The problem comes when I pass an invalid class. The TestCase should throw
a
failure: Class is null, or does not implement such and such. I am
wondering how I could test for that case. The failure does not seem to
throw an Exception, so I cannot test for that.

Am I right in thinking I will have to implement
junit.framework.TestListener
and listen for appropriate events ?

Thank you,
Francois Beausoleil
